summary: This document is an FBI interview summary (302 form) of a witness, referred to as M, detailing her recruitment and interview process with Ghislaine Maxwell and subsequent encounter with Jeffrey Epstein in New York in 2002. M describes being recruited for a massage therapist position, meeting Maxwell for a trial massage, and then meeting Epstein where she experienced inappropriate physical contact. The document provides insight into the recruitment tactics and initial interactions with victims.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Present during M's FBI interview at One Saint Andrews Plaza in New York. She is M's attorney.

persons.name: Eloisa De Laureanteis
persons.context: A woman who worked with M at a massage therapy school/workplace. She told M about an opportunity for four massage therapists to travel the world and coordinated M's initial contact with the recruiter, Sarah.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: A woman described as very pretty and the 'girl next door' type. She met with M in Santa Monica, California, to discuss the massage therapist position working for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. She told M that Maxwell was looking for someone to replace her.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Jeffrey Epstein's work partner and entrepreneur. She interviewed M at her New York townhouse, receiving a massage from her. Maxwell discussed the lifestyle, supported M's educational ambitions, and arranged for M to meet Epstein, instructing her to 'give him what he wants.'

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual M was recruited to work for. M met him at his New York brownstone after interviewing with Maxwell. During their meeting, Epstein engaged in inappropriate physical contact with M, including placing his foot on her lap and grabbing her jaw and buttocks.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned because M saw a framed photograph of him with Ghislaine Maxwell in Maxwell's townhouse, which reinforced to M that Maxwell was wealthy and successful.

persons.name: Cym Anne
persons.context: A person who sent M a follow-up email after her interviews in New York, thanking her for coming out and stating they were making a final decision. M was unsure of the exact name.

connections.description: Described by Maxwell as work partners and entrepreneurs. Maxwell recruited massage therapists for Epstein and instructed M to give Epstein what he wants.
Sarah was looking to be replaced in her role working for Epstein and Maxwell. She conducted initial recruitment meetings on their behalf.
Eloisa coordinated for M to speak with Sarah about the massage therapist travel opportunity.
M saw a framed photograph of Maxwell with Clinton in Maxwell's home, indicating a social or political connection.
During their meeting, Epstein engaged in inappropriate and sexually suggestive physical contact with M, including grabbing her jaw and buttocks.
Maxwell interviewed M for a massage therapist position, discussed the lifestyle, and facilitated M's meeting with Epstein.

events.title: M's Recruitment and Interviews in New York
events.description: M, recruited for a massage therapist position, travels to New York. She meets Ghislaine Maxwell for a trial massage at Maxwell's townhouse and then meets Jeffrey Epstein at his brownstone, where he subjects her to inappropriate physical contact.

events.title: Initial Recruitment Meeting in Santa Monica
events.description: M meets with a recruiter named Sarah at an apartment in Santa Monica, California. Sarah describes the opportunity to work for Epstein and Maxwell, stating Maxwell is looking for someone to replace her.

events.title: Epstein Found in Jail Cell
events.description: M recalls seeing a news article about Jeffrey Epstein being found in the fetal position in a jail cell, which led her to connect her past experience with the public case.

locations: One Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York (FBI interview location)
Dayton, Ohio (M's hometown and current residence)
Santa Monica, California (location of initial recruitment meeting)
New York, New York (location of Maxwell's townhouse and Epstein's brownstone)
Los Angeles, California (M's departure point for New York and where she returned)
keyFacts: The document details a recruitment pipeline for massage therapists for Jeffrey Epstein, initiated by associates like Eloisa De Laureanteis and Sarah, and finalized by Ghislaine Maxwell.

M's interview with Jeffrey Epstein involved multiple instances of inappropriate physical contact, including Epstein placing his foot on her lap and crotch, grabbing her jaw, and grabbing her buttocks repeatedly.
Ghislaine Maxwell explicitly instructed M to 'give [Epstein] what he wants' and told her 'Jeffrey always gets what he wants,' indicating her role in facilitating access to potential victims.
M did not initially know Epstein's last name and only connected her experience to the public case years later after seeing news about his arrest and jail cell incident.
The recruitment process involved flattery, promises of travel and educational support, and displays of wealth (e.g., Maxwell's townhouse, photo with Bill Clinton) to impress potential recruits.
